thread.title: New Town edges Catonsville for county supremacy
thread.title_full: New Town edges Catonsville for county supremacy

author: Craig Clary
title: New Town edges Catonsville for county supremacy
text:
(Bob Hough) 
New Town wound down the shot clock for each possession, and it paid off in the second quarter as a pair of 3-pointers by Smith and one in the final seconds by Khariah Kosh helped the Titans build a 24-18 lead at halftime. 
Dickey scored seven straight points, including five from the foul line, and the Comets took a 27-25 lead with 3:19 left in the third quarter, but the Titans rallied and led 31-30 after a pair of free throws by Ajae Petty with 43 seconds left. 
The game was tied 35-35 after a free throw by Catonsville's Staisha Daniels with 5:02 left in the fourth quarter. 
Two free throws by New Town's Kierston Brown gave the Titans a 37-35 lead with 3:59 left, and a basket by Kosh with 1:20 remaining pushed it to 39-35. 
Dickey's basket brought the Comets within two, 39-37, with 1:02 left, but New Town's Ajalant Garrison answered with a layup with 48 seconds and the lead was four again. 
A running bank shot by Catonsvile point guard Gabby Douglas cut the deficit to 41-39 with 20 seconds left and after the teams traded turnovers, Garrison sunk a pair of free throws with four seconds left to seal the win. 
Hibbert praised the play of his senior captain Smith after the win. 
"She is my captain, she's my leader, heart and soul," Hibbert said. "She said, 'coach, make sure everything goes through me.' Everybody else came together."
